snippet: A Dutch court ruled that United Nations peacekeepers from the Netherlands failed to protect the Bosnian Muslims during the 1995 massacre.
abstract: Dutch court rules that Netherlands government is liable for the deaths of about 300 victims of the 1995 Srebrenica massacre in Bosnia, Europe’s worst ethnically motivated mass murder since World War II, saying that United Nations team of Dutch peacekeepers failed to prevent those deaths.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and MARLISE SIMONS

lead_paragraph: A Dutch court ruled that United Nations peacekeepers from the Netherlands failed to protect the Bosnian Muslims during the 1995 massacre.

headline.main: Netherlands Held Liable for 300 Deaths in Srebrenica Massacre
headline.print_headline: Netherlands Held Liable for 300 Deaths in Srebrenica Massacre

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
